summary: DRIVERS SEAT BELT BUCKLE INOP....WILL NOT HOLD THE BELT IN TH E LOCKED POSITION, THEREFORE, SEAT BELT ENABLED IN CASE OF ACCIDENT.

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1991 LINCOLN TOWN CAR. THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE DRIVING AT 65 MPH, THE CONTACT HEARD A LOUD NOISE AND DISCOVERED THAT THE HOOD LATCH FRACTURED. AS A RESULT, THE WINDSHIELD CRACKED FROM THE FORCE OF THE HOOD AND A BUNGEE CORD WAS USED IN ORDER TO KEEP THE HOOD SECURED. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT DIAGNOSED OR REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE AND STATED THAT NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 95V151000 (LATCHES/LOCKS/LINKAGES) WAS PREVIOUSLY PERFORMED. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 174,600.

TL*  THE CONTACT OWNS A 1991 LINCOLN TOWN CAR. THE CONTACT STATED THAT DUE TO A BRAKE FAILURE, THE VEHICLE CAUGHT ON FIRE. THE FIRE DEPARTMENT EXTINGUISHED THE FIRE. THE VEHICLE WAS DESTROYED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 66,682.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1991 LINCOLN TOWN CAR. THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE DRIVING VARIOUS SPEEDS, THE VEHICLE SUDDENLY ACCELERATED AND THE CONTACT CRASHED. THERE WERE NO INJURIES. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT DIAGNOSED OR REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 27,000. THE VIN WAS UNKNOWN.

WHILE DRIVING EASTBOUND US INTERSTATE 40 IN OKLAHOMA CITY,OK MY 1991 LINCOLN TOWNCAR CAUGHT ON FIRE AND STOPPED RUNNING, AFTER I PULLED OFF THE HIGHWAY AND PUT THE FIRE OUT, THE CAR WOULD NOT START BACK UP. THE FIRE WAS COMING FROM THE ENGINE AREA, LOOKING AS IF IT WAS UNDERNEATH THE CAR SOMEWHERE. *TR

WHILE TRAVELING AT APPROX. 35 MILES PER HOUR ON A LOCAL BRIDGE, MY RIGHT REAR TIRE BLEW OUT. I DROVE A DISTANCE OF SEVERAL YARDS TO THE END OF THE BRIDGE WHERE I WAS ABLE TO PULL TO THE SHOULDER AND STOP. WHEN A VERY KIND POLICE OFFICER TRIED TO REMOVE THE DAMAGED TIRE, HE HAD TO STOP BECAUSE THE TIRE HAD SEPARATED LIKE A RECAPPED TIRE AND WOUND THE TORN PART AROUND THE BRAKE LINES AND AXLE. THE DAMAGES AND SERVICE CHARGES ARE ESTIMATED TO BE MORE THAN SIX HUNDRED DOLLARS. INITIALLY, THE SERVICE REPAIRMAN AT THE TIRE STORE (WHERE ALL OF THE TIRES WERE PURCHASED AND MOUNTED) INDICATED THAT ALL FOUR TIRES NEEDED TO BE REPLACED BECAUSE THEY SHOWED SIGNS OF "DRY-ROT." A SHORT TIME LATER, ANOTHER WORKER SAID ONLY THE DAMAGED TIRE NEEDED TO BE REPLACED. THERE SEEMS TO BE SOME PROBLEMS WITH MICHELIN TIRES SOLD WITHIN THE LAST FEW YEARS.  *TR

DRIVING ON EXPRESSWAY @ 55 MPH ( WINDY WITH 30 MPH GUSTS )  HOOD OPENED AND FOLDED UP OVER THE ROOF  BOTH HOOD LATCHES WERE STILL LOCKED TO THE STRIKE PLATE FROM HOOD  LUCKILY WAS ABLE TO PULL OVER TO THE EMERGENCY LANE  REPLACED HOOD AND STRUTS WITH USED ONES ( FROM A 1993 / SAFER? )  STILL HAVE OLD HOOD AND PLATE AVAILABLE.  *JB

DT: THE CONTACT STATED  1991 LINCOLN TOWN CAR HAD ONLY 17,000 MILES ON IT. ON 8-25-05 HE FELT LIKE HIS BRAKES WERE LOW. HE WENT TO HAVE THEM INSPECTED AND THE CAR PASSED THE INSPECTION,  BUT HE HAD THE BRAKES CHANGED ANYWAY. HE SMELLED THE BRAKES BURNING THAT DAY AS HE WAS DRIVING HOME FROM THE GARAGE. HE PARKED THE CAR IN THE GARAGE ,AND DID NOT DRIVE THE CAR UNTIL ABOUT A MONTH LATER WHEN HE SMELLED WHAT HE THOUGHT WAS THE BRAKES BURNING AGAIN. WHEN HE GOT IN TO  DRIVEWAY, HE SAW FIRE UNDER THE WHEELS. HE PUT THE FIRE OUT WITH A FIRE EXTINGUISHER. HAD HE NOT HAD THE FIRE EXTINGUISHER THE CAR WOULD HAVE BLOWN UP. THE GARAGE THAT FIXED THE BRAKES SAID THE CALIPER HUNG UP AND THAT WAS WHY THE FIRE HAPPENED. ALSO,   THE CONSUMER THOUGHT THIS MAY BE A DEFECT IN THE DESIGN OF THE BRAKES THAT WOULD CAUSE THE CAR TO CATCH ON FIRE OR DID NOT FIX THE BRAKES PROPERLY. HE CALLED FORD, AND THEY TOLD HIM THAT WITHOUT A WARRANTY  THEY DID NOT KNOW WHAT THEY COULD DO, AND THEN  THEY TOLD HIM THEY WOULD SUBMIT HIS COMPLAINT TO THE ENGINEERING DEPARTMENT. THE CONTACT WAS  NOT SURE IF THE CAR HAD ABS BRAKES BECAUSE THE CAR WAS A 1991 MODEL. HE THOUGHT IT DID BUT WAS NOT SURE. HE WAS THE ORIGINAL OWNER OF THE CAR. *AK

DT: 1991 FORD LINCOLN TOWN CAR.  WHILE  DRIVING THE CAR TURNED ON THE AIR CONDITIONING AND ABOUT 15 TO 20 MINUTES LATER SAW FIRE COMING OUT FROM UNDERNEATH THE HOOD, SURROUNDING THE RIGHT FRONT WHEEL.   PULLED OFF THE ROAD, BY THAT TIME THE CAR HAD A LARGE FIRE.  THE CONSUMER PUT THE FIRE OUT BY THROWING WATER ON IT. AFTER LOOKING AT THE CAR SAW THAT ALL THE WIRES WERE MELTED AROUND WHERE THE WHEEL WAS,  AND  ALSO THERE WAS  A MELTED RUBBER.   A FRIEND INSPECTED THE CAR.  HE CUT A WIRE THAT LET THE CONSUMER  DRIVE THE CAR HOME. WHERE IT WAS PARKED.   THERE WAS  A SHORT CIRCUIT IN THE WIRING SYSTEM.  THE CAR HAS NOT BEEN REPAIRED. *AK

I HAVE HAD PROBLEMS WITH GETTING THIS CAR (1991 LINCOLN TOWN CAR) THROUGH INSPECTION OVER THE LAST 3 YEARS, DUE TO SMOKING BECAUSE OF EMISSIONS PROBLEMS.  THE CAR HAD LESS THAN 100,000 MILES ON IT WHEN THIS PROBLEM STARTED, AND NOW HAS APPROXIMATELY 119,000 MILES ON IT.  THIS YEAR, I HAVE MADE 4 ATTEMPTS TO GET THE CAR TO PASS THE INSPECTION, HOWEVER IT HAS FAILED DUE TO THE SAME PROBLEM EACH TIME.  I HAVE TAKEN THE CAR TO MECHANICS, AND HAVE BEEN TOLD THAT THIS IS A MANUFACTURERS' DEFECT WITH THESE PARTICULAR CARS.  THEY STATE THAT THE VALVE SEALS GET HARD BECAUSE OF A FACTORY DEFECT AND NEED TO BE REPLACED.  HARDENED  VALVE SEALS ALLOW OIL TO BY-PASS THE VALVE SEALS AND CAUSE THE CARS TO SMOKE.  I FEEL THAT THE MANUFACTURER SHOULD REPLACE THE VALVE SEALS IN MY CAR, AND CORRECT THIS PROBLEM.  I WOULD LIKE TO KEEP THIS CAR, IF YOU CAN PLEASE STOP THE SMOKING, IT IS A GOOD CAR!  THANK YOU VERY MUCH.
WHILE TURNING LEFT VEHICLE WAS REAR ENDED.   UPON IMPACT DRIVER AND PASSENGER SEATS BROKE.  BOTH  DRIVER AND PASSENGER SUSTAINED MINOR INJURIES.   VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO A GARAGE.  *AK
WHILE DRIVING 65 MPH  VEHICLE STALLED.  THIS CAUSED LOSS OF STEERING AND BRAKES.  CONSUMER FOUND IN THE NHTSA WEB  28 COMPLAINTS ON THE SAME PROBLEM.  *AK
PAINT IS PEELING FROM CAR IN VARIOUS AREAS INCLUDING HOOD, ROOF, DOOR PANELS, AND TRUNK LID.
WHILE DRIVING, THE TIRE BLEW OUT.           *JB
CONSUMER STATES THAT THE WINDOW REGULATORS HAVE BEEN REPLACED ALL THREE REGULATORS THE TWO IN THE FRONT AND THE LEFT BACK ONE. CONTACTED DEALER

CONSUMER FOUND A CONSTANT LEAK UNDER VEHICLE. TOOK VEHICLE IN FOR REPAIR, AND DEALER FOUND OUT THAT FUEL LINE WAS CORRODED/ RUSTED AND NEEDED TO BE REPLACED, AS WELL AS THE BRAKE LINE. THIS CAUSED THE CAR TO TO FAIL TO START, AFTER REPAIRS WERE FINISHED THE PROBLEM WITH STARTING THE CAR WAS REMEDIED.  *JG *AK

WHILE DRIVING, TIRE EXPERIENCED A BLOWOUT, CONSUMER LOST PARTIAL CONTROL OF THE VEHICLE, HIT A CURB, DAMAGED ANOTHER TIRE AND BOTH RIMS, CONSUMER WAS INFORMED TO GO TO THE LOCAL GOODYEAR DEALER AND HAVE THEM TO SHIP THE DAMAGED TIRES IN ORDER TO BE REIMBURSED, THE CLAIM WAS SUBSEQUENTLY DENIED BECAUSE GOODYEAR STATED THEY ONLY RECEIVED ONE OF THE DAMAGED TIRES.(GOODYEAR REGATTA P21570R15 TIRES)*JB

CAR WOULD NOT START ON NUMEROUS ATTEMPTS, BATTERY FINE, NEW STARTER.  WHEN STARTED BY REPAIRMAN FROM UNDER HOOD, CAR  IMMEDIATELY STARTED MOVING DOWN THE STREET IN REVERSE WITH NO DRIVER, NEARLY HITTING TELEPHONE POLE.  SOMEHOW SLIPPED INTO REVERSE ON ITS OWN, YET KEY COULD BE REMOVED WITH EACH PREVIOUS ATTEMPT TO START IT. *AK

components: SERVICE BRAKES, AIR,ENGINE AND ENGINE COOLING
summary: CHECK ENGINE LIGHT IS ON AND OFF ALL THE TIME, I BOUGHT THE CAR LAST YEAR AROUND OCTOBER 2001, THE OWNER TOLD ME HE TOOK THE CAR TO THE DEALERS SEVERAL TIMES AND NOTHING THEY TOLD HIM NOTHING WAS WRONG WITH THE CAR, I BOUGHT THE CAR FROM THAT PERSON AND ABOUT 4 MONTHS LATER THERE IS WATER INSIDE THE MOTOR, IT WAS RUNNING PERFECTLY FINE.  ABOUT THE BRAKES, THERE IS A WIERD NOISE, IT'S NOT SQUEAKING, BUT WHEN YOU'RE AT A STOP SIGN  AND YOU LET GO OF THE BREAK A LITTLE THERE IS AN UNUSUAL NOISE.  I HAD THE CAR REPAIRED IN OCTOBER FOR THE HOOD LATCH RECALL,   MOST OF THE PLACES WERE REALLY BAD ABOUT HELPING ME WITH THE RECALL, THEY TOLD ME THAT THE CAR WAS TOO OLD.  I FINALLY GOT IT FIXED, BUT CAN THE OTHER PLACES ACTUALLY REJECT MY CAR FOR BEING TO OLD?  I NEED TO KNOW IF THERE ARE OTHER RECALLS ON MY VEHICLE, I TOOK IT TO THE DEALERS AND THEY SAID THAT THE OTHER RECALLS DON'T APPLY TO MY CAR.  IS THAT CORRECT?

CONSUMER SHIFTED VEHICLE INTO PARK FROM DRIVE, WHEN IT SUDDENLY ACCLERATED TO A HIGH SPEED, CONSUMER PRESSED THE BRAKE PEDAL, HOWEVER VEHICLE WOULD NOT STOP, VEHICLE CRASHED INTO A BANK, BOTH THE DRIVER AND PASSENGER SUSTAINED INJURIES, THE DRIVER SUSTAINED FACIAL INJURIES DUE TO THE DEPLOYMENT OF THE AIR BAG.   *SLC
THE A/C WAS NOT WORKING PROPERLY, IT DOES NOT COOL. A/C COMPRESSOR FAILED FOUR TIMES AND A/C CONDENSER FAILED. *YH
THE A/C WAS NOT WORKING PROPERLY, IT DOES NOT COOL. A/C COMPRESSOR FAILED FOUR TIMES AND A/C CONDENSER FAILED, ALSO THE A/C CONTROL BOX WAS REPLACED.*YH
WINDOWS WOULD NOT ROLL DOWN, DEALER REPLACED BAD REGULATORS.. *YH
BRAKES LOCK UP DUE TO BRAKE PAD FAILURE, THE BRAKES WORKED BETTER AFTER A NEW BRAKE BOOSTER UNIT WAS INSTALLED, BRAKE CALIPERS WERE REPLACED, REAR BRAKE BADS WERE REPLACED.*YH
THE AIRBAG SYSTEM FAILED THREE TIMES.*YH
REAR EMERGENCY LIGHT FAILED. *YH
RIGHT DOOR PANEL FAILED. *YH
WINDOWS WOULD NOT ROLL DOWN, DEALER REPLACED BAD REGULATORS.. *YH
THE AIRBAG SYSTEM FAILED THREE TIMES.*YH
RIGHT DOOR PANEL FAILED. *YH
WHENEVER IT  WAS RAINING AND  WINDSHIELD WIPERS  WERE TURNED OFF, THEY WOULD REMAIN IN AN UPRIGHT POSITION. WHEN TURNING  WINDSHIELD WIPERS BACK ON, THEY WOULD GO DOWN.*AK

A VEHICLE PULLED DIRECTLY IN FORNT OF CONSUMERS VEHICLE, CONSUMER WAS UNABLE TO STOP IN TIME AND COLLIDED WITH VEHICLE, IN WHICH THE SHOULDER BELT DID NOT RESTRAIN HIM, BUT THE LAP BELT DID, CONSUMER SUFFERED INJURIES.*JB

A VEHICLE PULLED DIRECTLY IN FORNT OF CONSUMERS VEHICLE, CONSUMER WAS UNABLE TO STOP IN TIME AND COLLIDED WITH VEHICLE, IN WHICH THE SHOULDER BELT DID NOT RESTRAIN HIM, BUT THE LAP BELT DID, CONSUMER SUFFERED INJURIES.*JB

A VEHICLE PULLED DIRECTLY IN FORNT OF CONSUMERS VEHICLE, CONSUMER WAS UNABLE TO STOP IN TIME AND COLLIDED WITH VEHICLE, IN WHICH THE SHOULDER BELT DID NOT RESTRAIN HIM, BUT THE LAP BELT DID, CONSUMER SUFFERED INJURIES.*JB
A PIECE OF THE FRAME ON DRIVERS SIDE SEAT THAT HOLDS SEAT UP BROKE.  IF CONSUMER WAS TO ACCELERATE HARD  BACK OF  SEAT WOULD NOT HOLD.  CONSUMER FEELS THIS IS UNSAFE.  *AK

AFTER DRIVING LEFT REAR TIRE WAS FLAT. THEN, APPLIED AIR AND IT WENT FLAT AGAIN. TAKEN  TO TECHNICIAN WHERE COULD NOT BE FIX IT BECAUSE  THE SIDE WALLS WORE OUT.  NEXT DAY  RIGHT REAR TIRE WAS HAVING THE SAME PROBLEM, AND HAD TO BE REPLACED. LINCOLN, TOWN CAR, 1991, P215/70R15, DOT BEM3NX71239.  *AK
MECHANIC SAID HE DID NOT KNOW WHY THEY CRACKED...AND THAT HE HAD NEVER SEEN ALL FOUR  CRACK AT ONCE....

WHILE TURNING ON THE IGNITION CAR TOOK OFF INTO THE HOUSE, AND HIT ANOTHER CONSUMER, INJURING THEM. SEPT OF 1998, CONSUMER PUT CAR IN REVERSE AND CAR TOOK OFF BACKWARDS, CONSUMER HAD TO  TURN OFF THE KEY TO STOP THE CAR.*AK

WE HAD A TREAD SEPARATION PROBLEM ON THIS TIRE IDENTICAL TO THE CURRENT FIRESTONE PROBLEM.  THE LEFT REAR TIRE BLEW OUT AT HIGHWAY SPEED WHILE TRAVELING ON US 1 BETWEEN FLORIDA CITY AND KEY LARGO.  FORTUNATELY THE CAR WAS KEPT UNDER CONTROL AND NO OTHER VEHICLES WERE COMING OPPOSITE ON THE TWO-LANE ROAD.  THE TIRE TREAD WAS PEALED OFF.  THE CAR WAS TOWED BACK UP TO MIAMI, TO THE FIRESTONE DEALER.  THEY SAID WE MUST HAVE HIT SOMETHING TO CAUSE THE PROBLEM.  THE CURRENT FIRESTONE PROBLEM WAS UNKNOWN TO US THEN, SO WE HAD TO BUY NEW TIRES (TWO TO MATCH).  THE CAR STILL HAS DAMAGE TO THE FENDER WELL.  THE SAME MODEL TIRES ARE ON THE CAR NOW, AND WE HAVE NEW CONCERNS ABOUT THEM DUE TO THE CURRENT PROBLEM.  THIS MODEL TIRE HASN'T BEEN IDENTIFIED TO ME AS PROBLEMATIC, BUT I READ IN OUR NEWSPAPER ABOUT SOMEONE HAVING A TREAD-SEPARATING BLOWOUT ALSO IN A LINCOLN TOWNCAR WITH FIRESTONE TIRES.  MAYBE THERE IS A  WIDE SPREAD FIRESTONE PROBLEM??  WE HAD NEVER SEEN ANYTHING LIKE THE TREAD SEPARATION, AND THOUGHT THAT WAS ONLY A RE-TREAD PROBLEM.  PLEASE ADD THESE TIRES TO THE PROBLEM LIST AND HELP US WITH OUR TIRE SAFETY.  THANK YOU.  *AK( DOT NUMBER:   TIRE SIZE: 215/70/R15 )
THE BRAKES OCCASIONALLY FAIL CAUSING THE CAR TO PULL TO THE LEFT WHEN THE BRAKES ARE APPLIED. DEALER TRACED CAUSE TO COLLAPSED BRAKE LINES.  NLM

ON MY BROTHER'S 1991 LINCOLN TOWN CAR EXECUTIVE SERIES, THE MAIN POWER WIRE TO THE HEADLIGHT SWITCH APPEARED TO OVERHEAT AND MELT INSIDE THE SWITCH ASSEMBLY CAUSING THE LIGHTS TO, AT FIRST, FLICKER OUT AND THEN COME RIGHT BACK ON AND AS THE PROBLEM PROGRESSED OVER A PERIOD OF 2 WEEKS THE LIGHTS WOULD COME ON FOR A SECOND OR TWO AND THEN NOT COME BACK ON AT ALL. I REPLACED THE SWITCH AND WIRE HARNESS FOR HIM, WHICH SEEMED TO FIX THE PROBLEM. BUT HE HAS SINCE SOLD THE CAR.  I ALSO ENCOUNTERED THE EXACT SAME PROBLEM ON MY FRIEND'S FATHER'S 1992 LINCOLN TOWN CAR (EXECUTIVE SERIES), I FIXED IT THE SAME WAY AND IT DOESN'T APPEAR TO HAVE COME BACK (I FIXED IT ABOUT 4 MONTHS AGO). BY THE WAY THE 1991 LINCOLN TOWN CAR DID NOT HAVE THE "AUTOLAMP" FEATURE AND THE 1992 DID.

APPROACHING A TRAFFIC LIGHT REALIZED I HAD NO ACCELERATOR PEDAL.  ENGINE WAS RUNNING AND I HAD BRAKES, I PULLED THE CAR OFF THE ROAD AND IT STARTED TO SMOKE, THEN FLAMES.   MY WONDERFUL LINCOLN WAS TOTALED.  THERE WAS NO INDICATION THAT THERE WAS ANY PROBLEM.  NO LIGHTS WENT ON THE CAR NEVER STALLED.  THE FIRE DEPARTMENT SAID THEY FELT THE LINE WAS BURNING, AND I LOST THE ACCELERATOR BECAUSE IT WAS ALREADY ON FIRE AND BURNED THROUGH.  I CHECKED THE RECALLS FOR 1991 LINCOLNS AND THERE WAS A RECALL FOR FUEL LINES, BUT NOT FOR MY VIN NUMBER.   THEREFORE WE NEVER RECEIVED A RECALL.  *AK

WHILE DRIVING ALONG 70MPH ALL OF A SUDDEN VEHICLE LOST POWER. THEN, IT PICKED UP AGAIN. NO WARNING LIGHTS CAME ON.  THE SECOND TIME THIS HAPPENED WAS WHILE DRIVING  AT 45MPH, AND ALL OF SUDDEN LOST POWER. DIDN'T CONTACT DEALER OR MANUFACTURER.  *AK
AIRBAG LIGHT KEEPS GOING ON & OFF.  THE CONSUMER HAS CONTACTED THE DEALER, BUT DOESN'T WANT TO HAVE THEM CHECK IT.  *AK
WHILE APPLYING THE BRAKES VEHICLE  SUDDENLY ACCELERATED BECAUSE THE ACCELERATOR PEDAL STUCK, RESULTING IN A COLLISION.  *AK
AIR BAG CLOCK SPRING FAILED CAUSING WARNING LIGHT TO ILLUMINATE.   MJS

VEHICLE EXPERIENCED SUDDEN ACCELERATION, CAUSING A THREE-CAR CRASH, AT SPEEDS EXCEEDING 80-85 MPH. WHILE ATTEMPING TO SHIFT TO PARK, TO SHUT OFF VEHICLE, IT CAUGHT IN REVERSE AND CONTINUED TO ACCELERATE BACKWARDS, CRASHING INTO THREE MORE VEHICLES. BOTH AIRBAG'S EXPERIENCED NO DEPLOYMENT. VEHICLE WAS TOTALLED.  PLEASE PROVIDE ANY FURTHER INFORMATION.   *AK  *YC
NONE

WHILE DRIVING AT 65 MPH THE VEHICLE ACCELERATED ON ITS OWN.  CONSUMER APPLIED THE BRAKES, AND THE VEHICLE KEPT ACCELERATING.  CONSUMER PUT THE VEHICLE INTO NEUTURAL, AND THE VEHICLE KEPT GOING. THEN PUT THE VEHICLE INTO REVERSE AND THE VEHICLE SLOWED DOWN AND THEN CAME TO A STOP.  *AK

VEHICLE WAS INVOLVED IN AN COLLISION. UPON  IMPACT FRONT MOUNTING BOLT OF DRIVER'S SPLIT SEAT BROKE, CAUSING ENTIRE SEAT TO FALL BACKWARDS, AND RESULTED IN LOSS OF VEHICLE CONTROL.   DRIVER SUSTAINED NECK INJURIES, AND FEET WENT THROUGH WINDSHIELD. VEHICLE  WAS TOTALED.  *AK
HEADLIGHT WIRE BURNED OUT DUE TO A SHORT.  THIS WAS THE SECOND TIME THIS HAPPENED.ANOTHER VEHICLE HIT  CONSUMER'S VEHICLE.  A/C UNIT BELT WASN'T WORKING, AND THERE  WAS SOME TYPE OF LOUD NOISE.  *AK

components: SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC,POWER TRAIN,VEHICLE SPEED CONTROL
summary: THE GROMET BROKE ON CABLES FOR TRANSMISSION. ONE CABLE FELL BEHIND THROTTLE BODY & CAUSED THROTTLE TO BECOME WIDE OPEN & VEHICLE ACCELERATED. ALSO, BRAKES  FROZE. HAD NO BRAKES AT ALL. HAD CONTROL OF VEHICLE. TAKING VEHICLE TO DEALER. *AK *ML
VEHICLE EXPERIENCED SUDDEN ACCELERATION ON TWO OCCASIONS, ONE INCIDENT RESULTED IN VEHICLE ACCIDENT AND INJURY (ATTORNEY FOR CONSUMER). MJS
DRIVER SEAT MEMORY BANK HAS MALFUNCTIONED, CAUSING DRIVER TO BE PUSHED UP AGAINST STEERING WHEEL. DOES NOT HAVE EMERGENCY RELEASE. *AK
DOOR LOCK SOLENOIDS IN THE REAR DOORS HAVE FAILED. MJS
WHILE DRIVING  AIR BAG LIGHT COMES ON AND OFF, INDICATING THERE IS A PROBLEM WITH THE AIRBAG SYSTEM, WHICH WON'T PROTECT THE OCCUPANT IN THE EVENT OF A CRASH.  *AK
THE CONSUMER PUT THE VEHICLE INTO GEAR AND THE VEHICLE JUMP OUT OF GEAR AND THE VEHICLE ACCELERATED OUT OF CONTROL AND DOWN A DRIVEWAY AND THE CONSUMER HIT A BRICK PLANNER.
WHENEVER COMPUTER GETS HOT, IT CAUSES VEHICLE TO STALL.  DEALER CAN'T FIND A SOLUTION.  *AK
AIR BAG WARNING LIGHT REMAINS ILLUMINATED, INDICATING A MALFUNCTION WITHIN THE SYSTEM. CAUSE UNKNOWN.  *AK
TURNED ON THE VEHICLE AND IGNITION SWITCH CAUGHT ON FIRE, RESULTING IN  INJURIES.  PLEASE PROVIDE FURTHER INFORMATION.  *AK
NO SUMMARY
NO SUMMARY LISTED FOR THIS VEHICLE.  *AK

WHILE DRIVING DRIVERS SEAT FELL OFF RAIL AND INTO THE REAR PASSENGER COMPARTMENT. MECHANIC SAID THAT THE INCIDENT WAS CAUSED BY THE PIN HOLE THAT SECURED THE DRIVER'S SEAT BEING WORN THROUGH. REPAIRWORK DONE AT OWNERS EXPENSE, APPROXIMATELY $320.00.  *AK *ML
STEERING BELT TENSION IDLER BROKE, CAUSING STEERING TO LOCK UP ,AND LOSS OF  VEHICLE CONTROL WHICH COULD HAVE RESULTED IN AN ACCIDENT. MANUFACTURER MADE A  NEW TOTALLY DIFFERENT PART TO REPLACE. *AK
VEHICLE CAUGHT FIRE UNDER THE HOOD ON THE DRIVER'S SIDE WHILE TURNED OFF. VEHICLE WAS TOTALED. CAUSE HAS NEVER BEEN FOUND.  *AK *ML
BRAKE LIGHT SWITCH TURNS ON/OFF UNLESS DRIVER STEPS ON THE PEDAL ALL THE WAY.
VEHICLE PARKED IN LOT. PEDESTRIAN NOTICED SMOKE FROM UNDER VEHICLE. FLAMES STARTED SHOOTING OUT. FIRE DEPT CALLED & PUT FLAMES OUT. TOLD FIRE ORIGINATED NEAR BRAKE LINE AREA. HAD VEHICLE TOWED.  *AK

MANUFACTURER'S RECALL # 91S-40/NHTSA RECALL 91V -147 & MANUFACTURER'S RECALL # 95S -14/NHTSA RECALL 95V- 091; VEHICLE WAS SERVICED  FOR THE ABOVE RECALLS CONCERNING HOOD LATCHES. REPAIRS WERE DONE SOMETIMES IN THE YEAR 1992 AND AGAIN IN 1996.  CONSUMER WAS DRIVING VEHICLE ON THE HIGHWAY AT APPROXIMATELY 65 MPH WHEN HOOD CAME UNLATCHED AND HIT THE WINDSHIELD, CAUSING A CRACK. CONSUMER BELIEVED THIS WAS A RECALL REPAIR FAILURE. DEALER NOTIFIED AND REFUSED TO REPAIR UNLESS COST IS PICKED UP BY THE CONSUMER.  *AK

ABOUT 20 MINUTES AFTER PULLING IN THE DRIVEWAY, THE IGNITION OFF,  THE VEHICLE CAUGHT ON FIRE IN THE ENGINE COMPARTMENT. THE FIRE WAS PUT ON BY THE FIRE DEPARTMENT. THE VEHICLE HAS BEEN TOTALLED.  *AK
WHILE DRIVING THE VEHICLE EXPERIENCED AN OIL SYSTEM FAILURE.  DEALER REPLACED  THE ENGINE.  *AK
ABS SYSTEM ACTIVATES ON ITS OWN.  WHEN TRYING TO STOP INTERRMITTENTLY STAY/LOCK UP/ DRAG AND DOES NOT MOVE. DEALER CANNOT DUPLICATE THE PROBLEM.  *AK
WHEN VEHICLE IS DRIVEN IN DAYLIGHT DRIVER IS NOT ABLE TO READ THE ELECTRONIC PANEL.  MANUFACTURER HAS BEEN NOTIFIED.  *AK
HEADLIGHTS FLICKER, AFFECTING  THE DRIVER'S VISIBILITY.  DEALER HAS BEEN NOTIFIED.  *AK
TWO (2) REAR AIR SHOCKS FAILED.
TRANSMISSION FAILED.
MOTOR MOUNTS FAILED.
ELECTRONIC SPEED MODULE FAILED.
AIR BAG FAILED FOR UNSPECIFIED REASONS.
AIR BAG FAILED FOR UNSPECIFIED REASONS.
FRONT BRAKE CALIPER FAILED (LOCKED UP) CAUSING DAMAGE TO ROTOR.
AFTER DRIVING APROXIMATELY 1 MILE, PARKED AUTOMOBILE IN CARPORT, LOCKED IT AND WENT INTO HOUSE. 16 HOURS LATER AUTOMOBILE EXPLODED, BURNING EVERYTHING AROUND IT,  INCLUDING CONSUMER'S HOME.  *AK
AFTER DRIVING APPROXIMATELY 1 MILE PUT AUTO IN CARPORT, LOCKED IT AND WENT INTO HOUSE- 16 HRS LATER AUTOMOBILE EXPLODED, BURNING EVERYTHING AROUND IT, INCLUDING CONSUMER'S HOME.  *AK

VEHICLE HAS GONE THROUGH A SERIES OR REPAIRS AND REPLACEMENTS FOR ELECTRONIC SEATS. DEALER---MAYO MOTORS---TREXLER TOWN, PA---REPAIRED VEHICLE SIX TIMES, DATES ARE BETWEEN 5-28-92 THROUGH 6-14-95.   HALDEMAN DEALERSHIP REPAIRED VEHICLE ON 7-10-95 ,AND WILL REPAIR FOR SECOND TIME ON MAR-12-98. THESE REPAIRS WERE ALL DONE ON THE DRIVER'S SIDE FRONT SEAT.
WHILE VEHICLE WAS PARKED IT CAUGHT FIRE IN THE ENGINE COMPARTMENT.  THE DEALER HAS NOT BEEN NOTIFIED.  *AK
WHEN BRAKES ARE APPLIED THE VEHICLE PULLS VIOLENTLY TO THE LEFT CAUSING DRIVER TO LOSE CONTROL.  THE BRAKE WARNING LIGHT NEVER ILLUMINATES.
CRUISE CONTROL FAILED.
ANTI LOCK BRAKES LOCK UP AND GRAB CONTINUOUSLY.

AFTER PUTTING VEHICLE INTO THE DRIVE GEAR, THE THROTTLE STUCK, CAUSING THE VEHICLE TO INCREASE SPEED, RESULTING IN AN ACCIDENT. APPLIED BRAKES, BUT THEY DID NOT STOP THE VEHICLE FROM ACCELERATING.   *AK
ANTI LOCK BRAKES FAILED SEVERAL TIMES.
STEERING COMPONENTS LOOSE.

CONSUMER STOPPED TO GET TICKET FORM PARKING MACHINE, THEN HEARD GRINDING METAL NOISES AS HE TRIED TO MOVE AWAY. HE THEN NOTICED THAT THE VEHICLE WAS NOT HEADED IN THE DIRECTION HE WAS STEERING. HE PULLED OVER AND WAITED FOR TOW TRUCK. TOW TRUCK DRIVER SAID THAT THE TIE ROD WAS DRAGGING UNDERNEATH. WHEN T/T DRIVER WAS PULLING VEHICLE ONTO TRUCK THE LEFT WHEEL DRAGGED SIDE WAYS. THE DEALER LATER TOLD HIM THAT IT WAS ALSO THE RIGHT SIDE CLAMPS THAT CAME OFF,  CAUSING THE PROBLEM.  *AK  VEHICLE EXPERIENCED WIRING PROBLEMS.  AIR CONDITIONER DID NOT WORK PROPERLY.  EMERGENCY BRAKE FAILED.  RADIO FAILED.   *SLC
WHEN BRAKES ARE APPLIED  THE VEHICLE JUMPS AND WARPS. THE OWNER HAD THE BRAKES TURNED, AND REPLACED THE ROTORS AND THE BRAKE PADS AND SHOES. THE DEALER HAS NOT BEEN ABLE TO FIND THE PROBLEM.  *AK
UPON APPLYING BRAKES, VEHICLE ACCELERATED OUT OF CONTROL, RESULTING IN A COLLISION. *AK
CONSUMER STATE UPON APPLYING FORCE TO THE BRAKE PEDAL THE BRAKES DO NOT RELEASE, CAUSING THE BRAKES TO LOCK UP. CONSUMER HAS CONTACTED THE DEALER.  *AK
